articles.headline: Latin American Companies Make Big U.S. Gains
articles.snippet: A group of successful and suddenly multinational Latin American companies are mounting a broadening surge of investment in the U.S.
articles.abstract: A group of successful and suddenly multinational Latin American companies are mounting a broadening surge of investment in the U.S.
articles.lead_paragraph: WILTON, Iowa — First came a wave of immigrants from Mexico and elsewhere in Latin America. Next came tortillas and Spanish-language soap operas, made in the United States, for a growing Hispanic audience in this country.

articles.headline: Rupert Murdoch Offers $5 Billion Bid for Dow Jones
articles.snippet: The unsolicited offer could set in motion the kind of takeover saga that readers might find in The Wall Street Journal, the flagship publication of Dow Jones.
articles.abstract: The unsolicited offer could set in motion the kind of takeover saga that readers might find in The Wall Street Journal, the flagship publication of Dow Jones.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a bold move to expand his global media empire, Rupert Murdoch, the head of the News Corporation, has made an unsolicited $5 billion offer to buy Dow Jones & Company, the venerable publisher of The Wall Street Journal, which he has long coveted.
articles.byline: By Richard Siklos and Andrew Ross Sorkin

articles.headline: Turkish Court Blocks Islamic Candidate
articles.snippet: Supporters of Abdullah Gul said the decision was simply an attempt to hold on to power by Turkey’s secular elite.
articles.abstract: Supporters of Abdullah Gul said the decision was simply an attempt to hold on to power by Turkey’s secular elite.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey, May 1 — Turkey’s highest court on Tuesday blocked a presidential candidate with a background in Islamic politics, pitching the country into early elections and a referendum on the role of religion in its future.

articles.headline: Giuliani’s Tie to Texas Law Firm May Pose Risk
articles.snippet: A firm that lobbies aggressively for coal-fired power plants has helped Rudolph W. Giuliani to gain support in Texas.
articles.abstract: A firm that lobbies aggressively for coal-fired power plants has helped Rudolph W. Giuliani to gain support in Texas.
articles.lead_paragraph: For a native New Yorker mounting a first bid for national office, Rudolph W. Giuliani has shown an impressive ability to raise money in Texas, where his Republican presidential campaign collected $2.2 million in the first quarter of the year, far more than any other candidate.

articles.headline: BP’s Chief Quits Over Revelations About Private Life
articles.snippet: John Browne resigned after losing a court battle with a tabloid over his sexual relationship with a younger man.
articles.abstract: John Browne resigned after losing a court battle with a tabloid over his sexual relationship with a younger man.
articles.lead_paragraph: John Browne, an aggressive but mannerly British magnate who transformed BP into one of the most successful global companies, resigned abruptly yesterday after losing a court battle with a London tabloid over details of his relationship with a younger man.

articles.headline: U.S. Seeks Closing of Visa Loophole for Britons
articles.snippet: Citing recent terror plots, U.S. officials want to curb the access of British citizens of Pakistani origin to America.
articles.abstract: Citing recent terror plots, U.S. officials want to curb the access of British citizens of Pakistani origin to America.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON, May 1 — Omar Khyam, the ringleader of the thwarted London bomb plot who was sentenced to life imprisonment on Monday, showed the potential for disaffected young men to be lured as terrorists, a threat that British officials said they would have to contend with for a generation.

articles.headline: Your Plate Is Bigger Than Your Stomach
articles.snippet: The way choices are presented to people — whether it’s 401(k)’s or food — has a huge effect on the decisions they make.
articles.abstract: The way choices are presented to people — whether it’s 401(k)’s or food — has a huge effect on the decisions they make.
articles.lead_paragraph: Late last year, a little book called “Mindless Eating” started appearing in bookstores. It was written by Brian Wansink, a Cornell professor who has spent his career doing brilliantly mischievous experiments about the psychology of eating.

articles.headline: Now Murdoch Must Persuade the Family
articles.snippet: Rupert Murdoch made a bid for Dow Jones so high that it may begin moving the Bancroft family in his direction.
articles.abstract: Rupert Murdoch made a bid for Dow Jones so high that it may begin moving the Bancroft family in his direction.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, with Dow Jones stock mired in the low 30s — and unhappy members of the controlling Bancroft family selling off some of their shares — Roy A. Hammer, the longtime trustee for the family, quipped to a reporter: “We’d rather sell at $60 a share. If you know any buyers, send them my way.”

articles.headline: Cablevision Nears Deal With Dolans
articles.snippet: Cablevision Systems is nearing a deal to sell itself to its founding family, the Dolans, for about $10.5 billion.
articles.abstract: Cablevision Systems is nearing a deal to sell itself to its founding family, the Dolans, for about $10.5 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cablevision Systems is nearing a deal to sell itself to its founding family, the Dolans, for more than $10.5 billion in cash, according to people involved in the discussions.
